term.title: pre-polymer molecule

item.text: A macromolecule or oligomer molecule capable of entering, through reactive groups, into further polymerization, thereby contributing more than one monomeric unit to at least one chain of the final macromolecule. A pre-polymer molecule capable of entering into further polymerization through reactive end-groups, often deliberately introduced, is known as a telechelic molecule.

sources.item: PAC, 1996, 68, 2287. 'Glossary of basic terms in polymer science (IUPAC Recommendations 1996)' on page 2290 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199668122287)
